definitions.text: a particular instance of buying or selling
examples: it was a package deal
I had no further trade with him
he's a master of the business deal

definitions.text: an agreement between parties (usually arrived at after discussion) fixing obligations of each
examples: he made a bargain with the devil
he rose to prominence through a series of shady deals

definitions.text: (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
examples: a batch of letters
a deal of trouble
a lot of money
he made a mint on the stock market
see the rest of the winners in our huge passel of photos
it must have cost plenty
a slew of journalists
a wad of money

definitions.text: a plank of softwood (fir or pine board)
wood that is easy to saw (from conifers such as pine or fir)
the cards held in a card game by a given player at any given time
examples: I didn't hold a good hand all evening
he kept trying to see my hand

definitions.text: the type of treatment received (especially as the result of an agreement)
examples: he got a good deal on his car

definitions.text: the act of distributing playing cards
examples: the deal was passed around the table clockwise

definitions.text: the act of apportioning or distributing something
examples: the captain was entrusted with the deal of provisions

definitions.text: act on verbally or in some form of artistic expression
examples: This book deals with incest
The course covered all of Western Civilization
The new book treats the history of China

definitions.text: take into consideration for exemplifying purposes
examples: Take the case of China
Consider the following case

definitions.text: take action with respect to (someone or something)
examples: How are we going to deal with this problem?
The teacher knew how to deal with these lazy students

definitions.text: come to terms with
examples: We got by on just a gallon of gas
They made do on half a loaf of bread every day

definitions.text: administer or bestow, as in small portions
examples: administer critical remarks to everyone present
dole out some money
shell out pocket money for the children
deal a blow to someone
the machine dispenses soft drinks

definitions.text: do business; offer for sale as for one's livelihood
examples: She deals in gold
The brothers sell shoes

definitions.text: be in charge of, act on, or dispose of
examples: I can deal with this crew of workers
This blender can't handle nuts
She managed her parents' affairs after they got too old

definitions.text: behave in a certain way towards others
examples: He deals fairly with his employees

definitions.text: distribute cards to the players in a game
examples: Who's dealing?

definitions.text: direct the course of; manage or control
examples: You cannot conduct business like this

definitions.text: give out as one's portion or share
give (a specific card) to a player
examples: He dealt me the Queen of Spades

definitions.text: sell
examples: deal hashish
